fb6feb785811.title: A little off-topic, but for those of you who use CPAs, how much do they charge?

paragraphs.name: c4c0
paragraphs.text: A little off-topic, but for those of you who use CPAs, how much do they charge? Mine charged $715 this year ($715 last year, $695 the year before that), which seems high to me. She’s very responsive, and I like her boss too, but the firm I used the previous year, who did my taxes on time but wouldn’t answer my emails, charged $400. Just curious what the spread is.

6e02fe841e41.title: So Nicole, what is your net income then?

paragraphs.name: b445
paragraphs.text: So Nicole, what is your net income then? Would it be the 68k minus the 21k? That seems like so much tax to me, but I’m not self-employed so I guess I’m more accustomed to what my post tax paycheck looks like!

virtuals.subtitle: *that taxes were much lower and flat but that’s another conversation for another day

c0073cf190fb.title: I wish* that employers listed salaries post-tax like they do in some countries.

content.subtitle: *that taxes were much lower and flat but that’s another conversation for another day

paragraphs.name: e0b2
paragraphs.text: I wish* that employers listed salaries post-tax like they do in some countries. Saying “I make $70,000" for example is clearer and feels better than “I make $100,000 but never see $30,000 of it so I really make $70,000 but I’m going to budget as if and tell people I’m making $100,000 and tax is just a giant expense.”

virtuals.subtitle: Because why not be transparent about how much tax we’re paying?

content.subtitle: Because why not be transparent about how much tax we’re paying?

paragraphs.name: 4f63
paragraphs.text: Because why not be transparent about how much tax we’re paying?

ed20c5d7085a.title: We got our taxes back from our accountant a few weeks ago and I went ahead and paid what we owed…

paragraphs.name: 20be
paragraphs.text: We got our taxes back from our accountant a few weeks ago and I went ahead and paid what we owed right away because I a) didn’t want the paperwork sitting around my house and b) didn’t want to forget about it. I was super disappointed because our accountant way underestimated my estimated taxes for 2016, even though our income situation didn’t change…

af1fe2f5cb14.title: I did my taxes last month and owed about $400 (combined between federal and state) above what had…

paragraphs.text: I did my taxes last month and owed about $400 (combined between federal and state) above what had been deducted from my pay. I’ve gotten money back the past couple of years (because I was in grad school and got a tuition deduction and a student loan deduction) but I knew I’d owe a little this year so I was prepared.

1189d18d82a1.title: I am so glad that my taxes get taken out automatically.

paragraphs.name: 9a25
paragraphs.text: I am so glad that my taxes get taken out automatically. It’s a lot less depressing to think about when you just never see that money to begin with.

paragraphs.name: c17e
paragraphs.text: That’s a good question! I think it might be more like business income minus business expenses minus taxes? Because my AGI includes additional factors like “deductible part of self-employment tax,” and while that reduces my tax burden it’s not the same as money in the bank? I do not know. Taxes are confusing.

70b9b4ecca06.title: Just found out that after paying my estimated taxes ($5k-ish), I only owe $2–3k more (depending on…

paragraphs.name: dc16
paragraphs.text: Just found out that after paying my estimated taxes ($5k-ish), I only owe $2–3k more (depending on if I do the SEP, which I probs will). I am SUPER RELIEVED to only owe $2–3k!! I was positive it was going to be like…$10k. Like, I told myself I wouldn’t cry if it was under $5k. Time to go hug my accountant.

virtuals.subtitle: I’d overpaid my 2016 taxes throughout the year — I had more writing income, plus a minor inheritance, in 2015, and he’d based my 2016…

paragraphs.text: My accountant finished up my taxes a couple weeks ago. 2016 stuff is all filed, 2017 Q1 freelance income is not yet (but will be this weekend, he prepped it for me, I just need to write the check and put it in the mail).

a3d27d5be0e3.title: Ouch! My summary says that my effective tax rate is 24.5%

paragraphs.name: 1cf2
paragraphs.text: Ouch! My summary says that my effective tax rate is 24.5% and my marginal tax rate is 28%. 99% of my income is from a standard office job…I wonder if that’s the difference?

3cf07ce0d5cb.title: I can say that I’m at a marginal tax rate of 25% and an effective tax rate of 36%.

paragraphs.name: 037d
paragraphs.text: I can say that I’m at a marginal tax rate of 25% and an effective tax rate of 36%. Because that’s what my CPA wrote on my tax summary.

be37a43a53e3.title: I filed mine in March and got my federal return in 3 days and my state return in like 3 weeks.

content.subtitle: I don’t recall the break down but I got a total of 7,000 dollars back. The number gets less every year but also I keep making more money so…

paragraphs.name: 2b68
paragraphs.text: I filed mine in March and got my federal return in 3 days and my state return in like 3 weeks. Way to drag your feet california.

paragraphs.name: d3b8
paragraphs.text: I don’t recall the break down but I got a total of 7,000 dollars back. The number gets less every year but also I keep making more money so I shouldn’t complain.

paragraphs.name: 9c92
paragraphs.text: I filed mine on Tuesday! I am getting a refund of over $900 (mostly federal but a bit from the state) because I was withholding as a dependent but am no longer one.
